overview: Before founding InstantBull, Gal was R&D product manager at Applied Science Labs, an MIT spin-off that develops eye-tracking systems, where he programmed the world’s first video game that makes use of the eye as a joystick. Gal was also leading eye-tracking research for applications as diverse as MRI medical research, dashboard layout optimization at NASA and improved website design. As an avid stock market investor with an in-depth understanding of new software tools, Gal was struck with the idea that he could create a new service that would save investors bundles of valuable time - thus was born InstantBull.
